title: List of past featured faces?
content: Hey everyone, A while ago Typophile was featuring a font that i really like, but i haven't the slightest clue as to what it was called. Is there a list or a way i can see previously featured faces? Thanks again! =]
author: Aanoi

comments.content:
Sorry, we don't currently have a list of the Features Fonts available on Typophile. If you can give me an idea of what it was you saw, I might be able to give you the name.

I think it would be a great idea moving forward, that we compile a visual list of everything we use.

You could try tracking Chris' posts...

[http://typophile.com/user/3135/track](http://web.archive.org/web/20120129144336/http:/typophile.com/user/3135/track "http://typophile.com/user/3135/track")

He almost always comments on the featured face.

Cheers, Si

Better track the posts by [Zara](http://web.archive.org/web/20120129144336/http:/typophile.com/user/21367/track) and [Nate](http://web.archive.org/web/20120129144336/http:/typophile.com/user/21367/track).

This is what I could track down. I’m sure there are still a few missing:

- before the ‘Featured Face’ era  
Mercury Display (for the homepage)
- 06/07  
Beorcana
- 08/07  
Super Duty
- 11/07  
Comic Sans
- 12/07  
Ommegaand
- 12/07  
FF Meta Serif
- 02/08  
FF Clan
- 04/08  
Paradigm
- 04/08  
FB Moderno
- 05/08  
FF Megano
- 05/08  
Scout
- 06/08  
FF Celeste
- 06/08  
ITC Franklin
- 06/08  
Doublewide
- 07/08  
FF Pitu
- 07/08  
Rocky
- 07/08  
FF Tisa
- 07/08  
P22 Underground
- 08/08  
Sloop
- 08/08  
FF Trixie
- 08/08  
Comalle

- 09/08  
Benton Modern Display
- 10/08

- 10/08  
FF Chambers Sans
- 10/08  
Malmö Sans
- 11/08  
Benton Sans
- 11/08  
Beorcana
- 11/08  
Whitman Display Italic
Thank you! You guys were a great help =] The typeface was FF Chambers Sans!
You guys are magical, I didn't even think of that.

<cite>I think it would be a great idea moving forward, that we compile a visual list of everything we use.</cite>  
yes please!

So is getting a featured face free?

hhp

<cite>is getting a featured face free?</cite>  
No:
